text: Louis Harry Feldman (October 29, 1926 - March 25, 2017) was an American professor of classics and literature. He was born in Hartford, Connecticut, and studied at Trinity College. He was the Abraham Wouk Family Professor of Classics and Literature at Yeshiva University, the institution at which he taught since 1955. Feldman was a scholar of Hellenistic civilization, specifically the works of Josephus Flavius.
